StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Germline De Novo Mutations with parent of origin in WGS trios

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This study was funded by the Inova Health System with support from Fairfax County and the philanthropic support from the Odeen family. We thank the Inova translational medicine institute staff for supporting the study. We also thank the families who participated in the genomic studies that made this research possible. This work was partly financially supported by grants from the Netherlands Organization for Scientific Research (916-14-043 to C.G. and 918-15-667 to J.A.V.), and the European Research Council (ERC Starting grant DENOVO 281964 to J.A.V.).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
The use of the “Germline De Novo Mutations with parent of origin in WGS trios” dataset requires local Institutional Review Board [IRB] approval. All requesters and data users must provide a letter from their respective institution’s IRB approving conduct of their proposed research project. Only full or expedited approvals will be accepted. The IRB letter must explicitly reference the use of “Germline De Novo Mutations with parent of origin in WGS trios” dataset.
The annual progress report should cite work done that relates specifically to the “Germline De Novo Mutations with parent of origin in WGS trios” dataset and not just a generic report for a series of datasets that may also have been requested at the same time.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
